meanings.definition: The form or outline of a wave.
meanings.sent1: The waveshape of the ocean wave was tall and majestic.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the waveshape of different types of waves to understand their behavior.
meanings.sent3: The artist painted a whimsical waveshape on the canvas, creating a playful scene.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter had a waveshape, starting softly and building into a joyful crescendo.
meanings.sent5: The waveshape of the mountain range against the sunset was breathtaking.

meanings.definition: The characteristic shape of a wave.
meanings.sent1: The waveshape of the sound wave determined its frequency.
meanings.sent2: Surfers can recognize the waveshape of different waves just by looking at them.
meanings.sent3: The waveshape of the cake batter in the pan resembled a mini tsunami.
meanings.sent4: His emotions had a waveshape, rising and falling like the tide.
meanings.sent5: The waveshape of her dance movements was graceful and fluid.
